name: scape
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
used to form nouns referring to an area that has a particular character because of the type of things that can be seen, heard, smelled, or experienced in it, or to a work of art that represents such an area: a warscape of empty, broken buildings a winterscape of bare trees The film designer has created a bleak futurescape. More examplesFewer examplesThree weeks of savage fighting has left the city a blasted warscape of empty, broken buildings.Millions of caterpillars turned the area into a winterscape last summer as they stripped the leaves off 130,000 acres of trees.Residents can relax and enjoy the sounds and sights of their own waterscape. The Rotterdam portscape is all glowing reds and yellows, its unearthly rectangles creating their own Mondrians.In the polar winter, temperatures drop to minus 50°C and winds gust up to 110mph, creating the stark blizzardscape that Jack London called "White silence".
